com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.android.graphics

Class WOWZTextManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.android.graphics.WOWZTextManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WOWZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer

    public final class WOWZTextManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements WOWZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
    A manager of assets, fonts, text objects, and other display properties.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int SCALE_BASIS_BASE_SIZE
      A basis for scaling the text as a factor of the original text size.
      static int SCALE_BASIS_CURRENT_SIZE
      A basis for scaling the text as a factor of the current scaled text size.
      static int SCALE_BASIS_FRAME_HEIGHT
      A basis for scaling the text as a factor of the video frame height.
      static int SCALE_BASIS_FRAME_WIDTH
      A basis for scaling the text as a factor of the video frame width.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static WOWZTextManager getInstance()
        Accesses the Wowza GoCoder SDK text manager.
        Returns:
        The Wowza GoCoder SDK text manager.

      • init

        public void init(android.content.Context context)
        Initializes the text manager and provides the application context. For use during SDK initialization; not necessary for client apps to call.
        Parameters:
        context - The app context.

      • release

        public void release()
        Releases the resources used by the text manager.

      • loadFont

        public java.util.UUID loadFont(java.lang.String file,
                               int size,
                               int padX,
                               int padY)
        Loads the specified font file, creates a texture for the defined character range, and sets up all required values used by the com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.devices.WZTextManager to render fonts.
        Parameters:
        file - The name of the font file (.ttf, .otf), in the Assets folder, to use.
        size - The height, in pixels, of the font.
        padX - The extra horizontal padding added to each character (x axis) to prevent overlapping.
        padY - The extra vertical padding added to each character (y axis) to prevent overlapping.

      • getFontById

        public WOWZTextManager.Font getFontById(java.util.UUID fontId)
        Gets the font for the specified ID.
        Parameters:
        fontId - The font's ID value.
        Returns:
        The font associated with the specified ID, or null if a font with the specified ID doesn't exist.

      • createTextObject

        public WOWZText createTextObject(java.util.UUID fontId)
        Creates an empty text object to be drawn using the font with the specified ID.
        Parameters:
        fontId - The ID for the font to use for this text object.
        Returns:
        A new text object, or null if the specified font ID is invalid.

      • createTextObject

        public WOWZText createTextObject(java.util.UUID fontId,
                                 java.lang.String text)
        Creates a text object using the specified string to draw using the font with the specified ID.
        Parameters:
        fontId - The ID for the font to use for this text object.
        text - The text string to draw.
        Returns:
        A new text object, or null if the specified font ID is invalid.

      • createTextObject

        public WOWZText createTextObject(java.util.UUID fontId,
                                 java.lang.String text,
                                 WOWZColor color)
        Creates a text object using the specified font, text string, and color.
        Parameters:
        fontId - The ID for the font to use for this text object.
        text - The text string to draw.
        color - The text color.
        Returns:
        A new text object, or null if the specified font ID is invalid.

      • createTextObject

        public WOWZText createTextObject(java.util.UUID fontId,
                                 java.lang.String text,
                                 float r,
                                 float g,
                                 float b,
                                 float a)
        Creates a text object using the specified font, text string, and color.
        Parameters:
        fontId - The ID for the font to use for this text object.
        text - The text string to draw.
        r - The red component of the text color (0.0 - 1.0).
        g - The green component of the text color (0.0 - 1.0).
        b - The blue component of the text color (0.0 - 1.0).
        a - The alpha component of the text color (0.0 - 1.0).
        Returns:
        A new text object, or null if the specified font ID is invalid.

      • createTextObject

        public WOWZText createTextObject(java.util.UUID fontId,
                                 java.lang.String text,
                                 float r,
                                 float g,
                                 float b)
        Creates a text object using the specified font, text string, and color.
        Parameters:
        fontId - The ID for the font to use for this text object.
        text - The text string to draw.
        r - The red component of the text color (0.0 - 1.0).
        g - The green component of the text color (0.0 - 1.0).
        b - The blue component of the text color (0.0 - 1.0).
        Returns:
        A new text object, or null if the specified font ID is invalid.

        Parameters:
        textObject - The text object to remove.

        Removes all text objects.

        public void setTextVisible(boolean textVisible)
        Sets the visibility of all text objects.
        Parameters:

      • isTextVisible

        public boolean isTextVisible()
        Indicates whether text object rendering is enabled.
        Returns:
        True if text rendering is enabled; false otherwise.

      • isWZVideoFrameRendererActive

        public boolean isWZVideoFrameRendererActive()
        Description copied from interface: WOWZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Checks whether the frame renderer is active. WOWZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer.onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw(WOWZGLES.EglEnv, WOWZSize, int) will only be called on an active renderer.
        Specified by:
        isWZVideoFrameRendererActive in interface WOWZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Returns:
        True if this renderer is active; false otherwise.

      • onWZVideoFrameRendererInit

        public void onWZVideoFrameRendererInit(WOWZGLES.EglEnv eglEnv)
        Description copied from interface: WOWZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Called at the beginning of a rendering cycle.
        Specified by:
        onWZVideoFrameRendererInit in interface WOWZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Parameters:
        eglEnv - The current OpenGL ES environment, which may be a different EglEnv than the one supplied with each call to WOWZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer.onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw(WOWZGLES.EglEnv, WOWZSize, int). See for WOWZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer.onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw(WOWZGLES.EglEnv, WOWZSize, int) for details.

      • onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw

        public void onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw(WOWZGLES.EglEnv eglEnv,
                                       WOWZSize frameSize,
                                       int frameRotation)
        Description copied from interface: WOWZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Called to render a frame of video to the viewport for the current OpenGL ES context. The eglEnv may differ at each call but you can assume that the EGL context in each instance in between calls to WOWZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer.onWZVideoFrameRendererInit(WOWZGLES.EglEnv) and WOWZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer.onWZVideoFrameRendererRelease(WOWZGLES.EglEnv eglEnv) are shared contexts and can access the same EGL resources.
        Specified by:
        onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw in interface WOWZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Parameters:
        eglEnv - The current OpenGL ES environment.
        frameSize - The size of the video frame, in pixels.
        frameRotation - The angle to apply when rendering, in degrees (usually 0).

      • onWZVideoFrameRendererRelease

        public void onWZVideoFrameRendererRelease(WOWZGLES.EglEnv eglEnv)
        Description copied from interface: WOWZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Called at the end of a rendering cycle.
        Specified by:
        onWZVideoFrameRendererRelease in interface WOWZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Parameters:
        eglEnv - The current OpenGL ES environment.
